text: Your Wednesday Evening BriefingHere’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
Listen to ‘The Daily’Confronting China.
‘On Tech With Shira Ovide’Congress doesn’t get big tech. By design.

$600 Unemployment Benefit Is Likely to Lapse Friday, Official Says“We’re nowhere close to a deal,” said Mark Meadows, the White House chief of staff, after talks with Democrats on the next round of aid.Democrats want to extend the full benefit through January, while Republicans in the Senate have called for scaling it back to $200 per week. Here’s the latest.

An Extra $600 a Week Kept Jobless Workers Afloat. What Now?A federal aid program is expiring, and Congress is deadlocked over its extension. For some, that means hunger, evictions or bankruptcies.

Lawmakers, United in Their Ire, Lash Out at Big Tech’s LeadersThe chiefs of Amazon, Apple, Google and Facebook faced withering questions — with sharply different aims — from both Republicans and Democrats.

Teachers Are Wary of Returning to Class, and Online Instruction, TooUnions are threatening to strike if classrooms reopen, but are also pushing to limit live remote teaching. Their demands will shape pandemic education.

Mysterious Coronavirus Surge Catches Vietnam by SurpriseAfter months without a single virus death, or even a confirmed case of local transmission, a new outbreak has struck Vietnam. And it’s spreading.

Federal Agents Agree to Withdraw From Portland, With ConditionsThe teams will begin a withdrawal on Thursday. Federal officials cautioned that they would do so only when they are confident the federal courthouse can be secured.
‘Wall of Moms’ Groups Mobilize NationwideThe movement that started with a few dozen moms in Portland, Ore., now has offshoots in cities across the country.
Barr Repeats Trump Falsehoods in Congressional TestimonyAttorney General William Barr echoed many of the president’s inaccurate claims on nationwide protests, police shootings and the coronavirus.
Crime sharply declined while Val B. Demings served as police chief in Orlando, but use of force by officers remained high. Scott A. Miller/ZUMA Press, via Alamy

LIVEElection Updates: Trump Plays on Racist Fears About Low-Income HousingIn remarks in Texas and in a tweet, President Trump tried to appeal to suburban voters, vowing to stop low-income housing from being built where they live.
Trump Says He Didn’t Ask Putin About Bounties on U.S. TroopsPresident Trump dismissed a scenario backed by U.S. intelligence as “fake news” in a new interview with Axios.

Kerry James Marshall’s “Black and part Black Birds in America: (Crow, Goldfinch),” 2020. It is one of two new works by the artist that David Zwirner Gallery will put on view this week. Kerry James Marshall and David Zwirner
